jsimple.json

    • jsimple.json.Json

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Json

        public Json()

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public static JsonObjectOrArray parse(Reader reader)
        Parse the specified JSON text, returning a JsonObject or JsonArray, depending on what the outermost container type is in the JSON. Per JSON spec, the root element in a JSON text is either an array or an object.
        Parameters:
        reader - JSON text
        Returns:
        JSON object tree, either a JsonObject or JsonArray object; use instanceof to distinguish

      • parseObject

        public static JsonObject parseObject(Reader reader)
        Parse the specified JSON text, returning a JsonObject. If the JSON isn't an object (e.g. is actually an array), then an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        reader - JSON text
        Returns:
        JsonObject object tree

      • parseArray

        public static JsonArray parseArray(Reader reader)
        Parse the specified JSON text, returning a JsonArray. If the JSON isn't an array (e.g. is actually a JsonObject), then an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        reader - JSON text
        Returns:
        JsonArray object tree

      • read

        public static java.lang.Object read(Reader reader)
        Return a JsonObjectReader or a JsonArrayReader for the specified JSON text, depending on what the outermost container type is in the JSON. The caller can use instanceof to determine which it is.
        Parameters:
        reader - JSON text
        Returns:
        JsonObjectReader or JsonArrayReader

      • readObject

        public static JsonObjectReader readObject(Reader reader)
        Assuming the JSON text is an object, return a JsonObjectReader, to iteratively read through the name/value pairs in the object one by one, to process each as it's parsed. If the object is big (normally always because it has descendant objects that can contain big arrays), this can be more efficient than parsing the whole JSON text into memory at once. If text isn't a JSON object (e.g. is a JSON array), a class cast exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        reader - JSON text, which should be a JSON array
        Returns:
        array reader, to read through the array

      • readArray

        public static JsonArrayReader readArray(Reader reader)
        Assuming the JSON text is an array, return a JsonArrayReader, to iteratively parse through the items in the array one by one, to process each as it's parsed. If the array is big this can be more efficient than parsing the whole JSON text into memory at once. If text isn't a JSON array (e.g. is a JSON object), a class cast exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        reader - JSON text, which should be a JSON array
        Returns:
        array reader, to read through the array

      • writeObject

        public static JsonObjectWriter writeObject(Writer writer)
        Serialize a JSON array, item by item. When an array is large and the root of a JSON text, this method is more memory efficient than creating a single JsonArray (including all items inside of it) in memory all at once and serializing that.
        Returns:
        JsonArrayWriter, to serialize each item

      • writeArray

        public static JsonArrayWriter writeArray(Writer writer)
        Serialize a JSON array, item by item. When an array is large and the root of a JSON text, this method is more memory efficient than creating a single JsonArray (including all items inside of it) in memory all at once and serializing that.
        Returns:
        JsonArrayWriter, to serialize each item

      • toLong

        public static long toLong(java.lang.Object value)
